free.chess
Class JBoard

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              free.chess.JBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class JBoard
extends javax.swing.JComponent

An implementation of a chess board component. IMPORTANT: This class is not thread safe - all modifications should be done in the AWT event dispatching thread.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Sets this JBoard to display the given Position.

setMoveInputStyle

public void setMoveInputStyle(int newStyle)
Sets the move input style of this JBoard to the given style. Possible values are DRAG_N_DROP and CLICK_N_CLICK.

getMoveInputStyle

public int getMoveInputStyle()
Returns the current move input style for this JBoard.

setMoveInputMode

public void setMoveInputMode(int newMode)
Sets the move input mode of this JBoard to the given mode. Possible values are NO_PIECES_MOVE, WHITE_PIECES_MOVE, BLACK_PIECES_MOVE, ALL_PIECES_MOVE and CURRENT_PLAYER_MOVES.

getMoveInputMode

public int getMoveInputMode()
Returns the current move input mode for this JBoard.

public void setEditable(boolean isEditable)
Sets whether pieces can at all be moved.

isEditable

public boolean isEditable()
Returns true if the board is editable, i.e. the pieces can at all be moved.

setDraggedPieceStyle

public void setDraggedPieceStyle(int newStyle)
Sets the dragged piece style to the given style. Possible values are NORMAL_DRAGGED_PIECE and CROSSHAIR_DRAGGED_PIECE.

getDraggedPieceStyle

public int getDraggedPieceStyle()
Returns the current dragged piece style.

getMoveHighlightingStyle

public int getMoveHighlightingStyle()
Returns the move highlighting style.

setHighlightedMove

public void setHighlightedMove(Move move)
Sets the currently highlighted move, or null if no move should be highlighted.

setFlipped

public void setFlipped(boolean isFlipped)
Sets the board's flipped state. When the board is flipped, it displays the black side at the bottom.

isFlipped

public boolean isFlipped()
Returns true if the JBoard is flipped, false otherwise.

setManualPromote

public void setManualPromote(boolean isManualPromote)
Sets whether the user will be prompted which piece to promote to when a promotion occurs or will the default promotion piece be used.

isManualPromote

public boolean isManualPromote()
Returns true if on a promotion move, the user will be prompted which piece he wants to promote to, returns false if the default promotion piece will be used without prompting the user.

public java.awt.Color getDragSquareHighlightingColor()

Sets the shaded state of the specified square.

clearShaded

public void clearShaded()
Sets all the SQUARES to the unshaded state.

isShaded

public boolean isShaded(Square square)
Returns true iff the specified square is shaded.

isMovingPiece

public boolean isMovingPiece()
Returns true iff a piece is currently being moved/dragged.

cancelMovingPiece

public void cancelMovingPiece()
If a piece is currently being moved/dragged, the moving/dragging is canceled and the moved/dragged piece is returned to its original location. If no piece is currently being moved/dragged, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

drawSquare

protected void drawSquare(java.awt.Graphics g,
                          Square circleSquare,
                          int size,
                          java.awt.Color color)
Draws an outline of a square of the given size at the specified square on the given Graphics object with the specific color. The size specifies the width of the outline.

squareToRect

public java.awt.Rectangle squareToRect(Square square,
                                       java.awt.Rectangle squareRect)
Returns the rectangle (in pixels) of the given square.

squareToRect

public java.awt.Rectangle squareToRect(int file,
                                       int rank,
                                       java.awt.Rectangle squareRect)
Returns the rectangle (in pixels) of the given square.

getMovedPieceRect

public java.awt.Rectangle getMovedPieceRect(java.awt.Rectangle rect)
Returns a Rectangle (in pixels) of the piece currently being dragged, or null if no piece is currently being dragged. The resulting value is put in the specified Rectangle (unless the resulting value is null, or the specified Rectangle is).

locationToSquare

public Square locationToSquare(int x,
                               int y)
Returns the square corresponding to the given coordinate (in pixels). Returns null if the given location is not on the visible board.

locationToSquare

public Square locationToSquare(java.awt.Point p)
Returns the square corresponding to the given coordinate (in pixels).

getPreferredSize

public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
Returns the preferred size of this JBoard. The PiecePainter is consulted when determining the preferred size. If it returns a Dimension that has no area (width<=0 or height<=0), the BoardPainter is consulted. If it returns a Dimension with no area too, some acceptable size in which width==height is returned.

Overrides:
getPreferredSize in class javax.swing.JComponent

getMinimumSize

public java.awt.Dimension getMinimumSize()
Returns the minimum size of this JBoard. This method returns the minimum reasonable size of a chess board - about 80x80.

Overrides:
getMinimumSize in class javax.swing.JComponent

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Displays a simple JFrame with a JBoard.
